content.body: bakkot: Michael Ficarra i'm about to write some real cursed spec stuff about inspecting execution contexts, would like to get your thoughts

bakkot: Michael Ficarra i'm about to write some real cursed spec stuff about inspecting execution contexts, would like to get your thoughts

content.body: i want to check if a Parse Node _pn_ is currently undergoing Evaluation (i.e. it's either being evaluated itself or is contained in the top-level Parse Node being evaluated) in a non-suspended execution context on the execution context stack
content.formatted_body: i want to check if a Parse Node pn is currently undergoing Evaluation (i.e. it's either being evaluated itself or is contained in the top-level Parse Node being evaluated) in a non-suspended execution context on the execution context stack

content.body: i'm not sure what the best way to write this prose is other than, basically, what i said
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: i'm not sure what the best way to write this prose is other than, basically, what i said

content.body: i'd prefer to avoid building out spec machinery for this since it's for a fairly small use case for refining liveness guarantees of template objects which i'm writing up
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: i'd prefer to avoid building out spec machinery for this since it's for a fairly small use case for refining liveness guarantees of template objects which i'm writing up

content.body: actually maybe i should just add a ParseNodeBeingEvaluated component
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: actually maybe i should just add a ParseNodeBeingEvaluated component

content.body: casing on Function and ScriptOrModule almost works, except for these iterators that were created from Abstract Closures, hm
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: casing on Function and ScriptOrModule almost works, except for these iterators that were created from Abstract Closures, hm

content.body: Note that there are a couple uses of "that is being evaluated" in the spec that might or might not assume the same semantics.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Note that there are a couple uses of "that is being evaluated" in the spec that might or might not assume the same semantics.

content.body: (I don't expect they'll help you, but they might be other places that could use something you introduce.)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: (I don't expect they'll help you, but they might be other places that could use something you introduce.)

content.body: Does "a non-suspended execution context on the execution context stack" mean something other than "the running execution context"?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Does "a non-suspended execution context on the execution context stack" mean something other than "the running execution context"?

content.body: but i in fact think i misspoke, the property i need to specify should be looking at all execution contexts
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: but i in fact think i misspoke, the property i need to specify should be looking at all execution contexts

content.body: all ECs on the stack, or all ECs in the agent?
